name: California Chardonnay
description: California Chardonnay typically offers ripe tropical fruit flavors, creamy texture, and noticeable oak from barrel aging. Produced in regions like Napa and Sonoma, it's known for its bold, rich style influenced by California's warm climate.

name: White Burgundy (Chardonnay)
description: White Burgundy, made from Chardonnay grapes in France's Burgundy region, features notes of citrus, green apple, and a distinct minerality. These wines often reflect a cooler climate with refined acidity and complex structure, especially in areas like Chablis or Meursault.

name: Sancerre (Sauvignon Blanc)
description: Sancerre is a Sauvignon Blanc from the Loire Valley in France known for its zesty acidity, grassy notes, and flinty minerality. The region's limestone soils contribute to its crisp, refreshing character.

name: Australian Chardonnay
description: Australian Chardonnay ranges from lean and mineral in regions like Margaret River to rich and oaky in places like the Hunter Valley. Common flavors include peach, melon, and vanilla with a warm-climate ripeness.

name: California Sauvignon Blanc
description: California Sauvignon Blanc is vibrant and fruit-forward with flavors of lime, grapefruit, and sometimes tropical notes. Produced throughout California, especially in Napa and Sonoma, it often exhibits a zippy, refreshing acidity.

name: New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc
description: New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc, particularly from Marlborough, bursts with aromas of passionfruit, gooseberry, and citrus zest. It's celebrated for its sharp acidity and bold, aromatic character shaped by the cool maritime climate.

name: South African Chenin Blanc
description: South African Chenin Blanc, also known as Steen, showcases flavors of yellow apple, honey, and sometimes tropical fruit. Grown primarily in the Western Cape, it can range from fresh and crisp to rich and barrel-aged.

name: German Riesling
description: German Riesling is renowned for its balance of sweetness and acidity, often featuring notes of green apple, lime, and petrol in aged examples. Grown along the Mosel and Rhine rivers, these wines reflect the steep slate vineyards and cool climate.

name: Oregon Pinot Gris
description: Oregon Pinot Gris offers flavors of pear, apple, and citrus with a creamy or slightly spicy finish. The Willamette Valley's cool climate helps retain the grape's natural acidity, producing fresh and food-friendly wines.

name: Argentinian Torrontés
description: Argentinian Torrontes is highly aromatic with floral notes of jasmine, rose petal, and flavors of stone fruit. Grown mainly in the high-altitude vineyards of Salta, it's crisp, dry, and refreshing despite its perfumed nose.

name: New Zealand Chardonnay
description: New Zealand Chardonnay typically exhibits fresh citrus and stone fruit flavors, with restrained oak and vibrant acidity. Regions like Hawke's Bay and Marlborough produce styles that balance fruitiness with minerality.

name: Vouvray (Chenin Blanc)
description: Vouvray is a Chenin Blanc from the Loire Valley offering flavors of quince, apple, and honey, often with a waxy texture. It can be dry, off-dry, or sparkling, depending on the producer and vintage.

name: White Bordeaux (blend)
description: White Bordeaux is a blend often made with Sauvignon Blanc and Semillon, offering grapefruit, herbs, and a touch of oak. These wines hail from regions like Pessac-Léognan and Graves and balance acidity with richness.

name: Muscadet (Loire Valley)
description: Muscadet from the Loire Valley is made from the Melon de Bourgogne grape and is known for its light body, briny minerality, and citrusy freshness. It pairs perfectly with shellfish and reflects the maritime climate of the Pays Nantais.

name: Condrieu (Viognier)
description: Condrieu is a Viognier-based wine from the Rhône Valley, featuring lush flavors of apricot, peach, and floral notes with a full, oily texture. It's a rare and aromatic white from steep granite slopes.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape (white blend)
description: Châteauneuf-du-Pape white blends include grapes like Grenache Blanc, Roussanne, and Clairette, yielding full-bodied wines with notes of stone fruit, herbs, and honey. These Rhône Valley whites are rich, textural, and age-worthy.

name: Willamette Valley Pinot Noir
description: Willamette Valley Pinot Noir is known for its elegance, red fruit flavors, and earthy undertones. Oregon's cool climate and volcanic soils help produce balanced wines with finesse and complexity.

name: California  Pinot Noir
description: California Pinot Noir offers ripe cherry, raspberry, and cola flavors with varying levels of oak and spice. Grown in coastal regions like Sonoma and Santa Barbara, it tends to be more fruit-forward than Old World versions.

name: Red Burgundy (Pinot Noir)
description: Red Burgundy, made from Pinot Noir, comes from France's Cote d'Or and shows flavors of tart cherry, mushroom, and forest floor. The cooler climate and limestone soils give it a refined, earthy structure and aging potential.

name: New Zealand Pinot Noir
description: New Zealand Pinot Noir, particularly from Central Otago and Martinborough, offers red fruit flavors with herbal and spice notes. The wines have bright acidity and a smooth texture, shaped by a cool, maritime climate.

name: Loire Valley Cabernet Franc (Chinon)
description: Loire Valley Cabernet Franc, especially from Chinon, features notes of red currant, bell pepper, and earthy minerality. It's lighter in body and tannin, with vibrant acidity and a savory profile.

name: German Pinot Noir (Spätburgunder)
description: German Pinot Noir, or Spätburgunder, is lighter in color with flavors of cherry, cranberry, and subtle earthy spice. It grows well in regions like Baden and the Pfalz, where warmer conditions allow fuller ripening.

name: California Syrah
description: California Syrah offers bold flavors of blackberry, black pepper, and smoky oak with a rich, full-bodied mouthfeel. It's grown in warm regions like Paso Robles and also in cooler areas like Sonoma Coast for more peppery styles.

name: Red Bordeaux (blend)
description: Red Bordeaux blends combine Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and other varietals to create structured, age-worthy wines with flavors of blackcurrant, plum, and graphite. These wines hail from both Left Bank and Right Bank regions of Bordeaux.

name: California Cabernet Sauvignon
description: California Cabernet Sauvignon is known for its bold structure, ripe blackberry and cassis flavors, and firm tannins. Regions like Napa Valley produce powerful, age-worthy versions with oak and spice.

name: California Merlot
description: California Merlot delivers smooth tannins with flavors of ripe plum, black cherry, and cocoa. It's a softer red grown widely in Napa and Sonoma, offering approachability and medium body.

name: California Zinfandel
description: California Zinfandel is a bold red wine with jammy blackberry fruit, spice, and sometimes a touch of sweetness or heat. It thrives in regions like Lodi and Sonoma, often producing high-alcohol, fruit-driven wines.

name: Australian Shiraz
description: Australian Shiraz is a full-bodied red with intense blackberry, pepper, and dark chocolate flavors. Grown extensively in Barossa Valley and McLaren Vale, it's known for its bold character and aging potential.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape (red blend)
description: Châteauneuf-du-Pape red blends are Grenache-based wines from the southern Rhône Valley with ripe red fruit, herbs, and spice. These wines are powerful, complex, and often blended with up to a dozen varietals.

name: Australian Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Australian Cabernet Sauvignon typically offers notes of blackcurrant, mint, and eucalyptus with firm tannins. It's especially prominent in Coonawarra and Margaret River, where cooler climates enhance its structure.

name: Argentinian Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Argentinian Cabernet Sauvignon displays dark fruit flavors like black cherry and plum with notes of tobacco and spice. Grown in Mendoza at high altitudes, the wines have freshness and concentration.

name: Argentinian Malbec
description: Argentinian Malbec is known for its deep color, rich blackberry and plum flavors, and smooth, velvety tannins. Mendoza's high-altitude vineyards provide the intensity and balance that define its style.

name: Chilean Merlot
description: Chilean Merlot is a medium-bodied red with flavors of red berries, plum, and subtle herbal notes. Chile's Central Valley provides a consistent climate for producing soft, approachable wines.

name: Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon features ripe cassis, green pepper, and a touch of vanilla oak. Grown in Maipo and Colchagua Valleys, it's known for its structure and value.

name: Washington State Syrah
description: Washington State Syrah combines bold dark fruit with pepper, smoke, and earthy complexity. Grown in Columbia Valley and Walla Walla, it balances ripeness with a cool-climate edge.

name: Washington State Merlot
description: Washington State Merlot shows rich plum and black cherry flavors with medium tannins and subtle oak. It thrives in eastern Washington's dry, sunny vineyards and often rivals more expensive Merlot from California.

name: Washington State Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Washington State Cabernet Sauvignon is structured and intense, offering flavors of blackcurrant, cocoa, and herbs. Known for its balance of fruit and acidity, it is grown widely in Columbia Valley.

name: California Cabernet Sauvignon
description: California Cabernet Sauvignon is rich and full-bodied with flavors of blackcurrant, cedar, and toasted oak. Napa Valley versions are especially known for their power, depth, and long aging potential.

name: Italian Sangiovese (Chianti Classico)
description: Italian Sangiovese, especially from Chianti Classico, shows cherry, dried herbs, and leather with bright acidity and firm tannins. These wines are central to Tuscany and pair beautifully with tomato-based cuisine.

name: Italian Nebbiolo (Barolo)
description: Italian Nebbiolo from Barolo is known for its powerful tannins, high acidity, and flavors of tar, roses, and dried cherry. Grown in Piedmont, it's one of Italy's most age-worthy and structured wines.

name: Spanish Tempranillo (Rioja)
description: Spanish Tempranillo from Rioja offers flavors of dried red fruit, tobacco, and spice, often with oak influence. Rioja wines range from fresh and fruity to deeply aged Gran Reservas with complex character.

name: Super Tuscan (blend)
description: Super Tuscans are bold red blends from Tuscany that often include Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Sangiovese. They defy traditional Italian DOC rules to create rich, polished wines with international appeal.

name: South African Red Blend
description: South African Red Blends commonly feature Bordeaux varietals with a mix of ripe dark fruit, earthy spice, and firm structure. These wines reflect the country's diverse terroirs and old-meets-new-world style.

name: South African Pinotage
description: South African Pinotage is a uniquely South African grape known for smoky, brambly flavors of dark fruit, coffee, and earth. It's a cross between Pinot Noir and Cinsault, producing bold, rustic reds grown mainly in the Western Cape.

name: Beaujolais (Gamay from Burgundy)
description: Beaujolais is a vibrant red wine from the southern part of Burgundy in eastern France, made primarily from the Gamay grape. Known for its light body, low tannins, and bright flavors of red berries, violets, and subtle spice, it offers a fresh and approachable profile often enjoyed slightly chilled.
